articles.description: Follow live text and radio coverage of three Premier League games, with Arsenal and Aston Villa both in action.
articles.title: Premier League: Build-up to three games, with Arsenal & Villa in action

articles.description: Follow live text updates as Bayern Munich face Stuttgart in the Bundesliga, before Real Madrid host Villarreal in La Liga.
articles.title: Bayern Munich face Stuttgart, before Real Madrid host Villarreal

articles.description: Manchester United prevent Liverpool from moving to the top of the Premier League table by holding them to a goalless draw at Anfield.
articles.title: Liverpool fail to go top as Man Utd earn Anfield draw

articles.description: Captain James Tavernier delivers once again for Rangers as they edge out Aberdeen to claim their first Scottish League Cup in more than 12 years.
articles.title: Tavernier goal gives Rangers final win over Aberdeen

articles.description: How Australia spinner Nathan Lyon moved from groundsman to an unexpected Australian legend with 500 Test wickets to his name.
articles.title: 'He goes from Mr Bean to Thor' - Lyon's journey to 500 wickets

articles.description: Follow live text updates and BBC Radio 5 Sports Extra as Aston Villa host Brighton in the Women's Super League.
articles.title: WSL: Aston Villa v Brighton build-up - radio & text

articles.description: Arsenal eventually see off a stubborn Brighton to move back above Liverpool - for a few hours at least - at the top of the Premier League.
articles.title: Arsenal edge past Brighton to go top of table

articles.description: Ian Wright tells Des Lynam that Match of the Day is his 'Graceland' as he makes his first appearance as a pundit on the programme alongside Sir Trevor Brooking back in 1997.
articles.title: 'This is my Graceland, Des!' - Wright's MOTD debut

articles.description: Harlequins concede seven tries in a 47-19 Investec Champions Cup thrashing by Toulouse at the Stoop.
articles.title: Harlequins thrashed at home by brilliant Toulouse

articles.description: Aston Villa come from behind to beat Brentford following a controversial red card for Bees defender Ben Mee.
articles.title: Villa beat Brentford after controversial red card
